alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 15 at 8:55AM PST until February 15 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, east winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 degree possible. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. Extended exposure to cold can cause hypothermia for animals and people. Vehicle windshields will be frosted.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.
